## **Description**
The **Replace **operator allows to replace part of an input string with a substring defined in the configuration settings.

## **Input**
**Input**

**Data type**

**Description**

**in0**

String

The string to which you want to apply the partial replacement

## **Output**
**Output**

**Data type**

**Description**

**out0**

String

The resulting string

## **![](data:image/png;base64,)****Settings**
- In the **Find **text field, type the substring that you want to locate in the input string.

- In the **Replace **text field, type the string value that you want to use for the replacement.

- *(optional) *Select the **Use regular expression **option if you want to use regular expressions in the search pattern.

*(optional) *Select the **Replace first match **option that appears when you enable the previous option if you want to only replace the first occurrence of the substring in the input data.

> Note

If unselected, the operator will replace all occurrences of the substring (default behavior).

- Click **Apply **to confirm.

## **Special cases**
In special cases, the operator behaves as follows:

**Case**

**Behavior**

**NULL input (no input)**

The operator considers a NULL input as an empty string. The system logs a warning event.

**Input with NULL value**

The operator considers an input with NULL value as an empty string. The system logs a warning event.
